Mid-mounted wings similar to the Tu-154 but more rounded.
Rounded nose that gives it a distinct profile.
Unique tail design providing stability while flying.
Model B200: Tri-engine configuration with engines situated on the wings.
Visibly large, rounded fuselage with a robust appearance.
High-mounted wings that taper towards the tips.
Large, prominent cockpit with an angular nose.
Bulkier design catering to regional transportation needs.
PA-28: Tri-jet configuration with engines mounted under the wings and on the rear.
Larger, more cylindrical fuselage compared to PA-28.
Tapered, swept-back wings with a high aspect ratio.
A noticeably pronounced cockpit area with multiple window configurations.
Advanced aerodynamic features for better flight characteristics.
SR-20: Tri-jet configuration with distinctive engines mounted on the rear.
Rounded, wide fuselage for spacious cabin arrangements.
High wings contributing to stability during flight.
Large cabin windows for improved passenger experience.
Retractable landing gear similar to other jet airliners.
Saab 2000: Tri-engine configuration with a rounded nose design.
High-mounted wings with engines mounted on the wings.
Longer fuselage facilitating more passenger space.
Boxy tail structure with a large rudder.
Modern design elements combined with traditional styling.
Saab 340: Tri-jet configuration with engines mounted on the wings.
Wider body compared to the Saab 340, appearing more aircraft-like.
Rounded nose shape with large cockpit windows.
High-mounted wings with visible dihedral angle.
Rear fuselage design featuring a distinctive tail section.
Spitfire: Tri-engine layout with engines mounted on the fuselage.
High-mounted wings with typical diherdral angles.
Wide-body fuselage for passenger capacity.
Larger cabin windows offering ample viewing.
Rounded nose for improved aerodynamics.
Tornado: Widebody fuselage offering significant passenger capacity.
Three-engine configuration with engines mounted on the wings.
T-tail design assisting with stability during flight.
Distinctive rounded nose and broad cockpit windows.
Shorter wing length enhancing maneuverability for its size.
Tu-134: Tri-jet design with engines mounted high on the fuselage.
Large, rounded nose similar in profile to Tu-154.
More extensive wingspan providing increased lift.
Distinctive rear-mounted engines leading to a unique silhouette.
Wider passenger cabin resulting in a beefier appearance compared to Tu-134.
Tu-154: Tri-engine configuration with engines mounted on the rear fuselage.
Broader, shorter fuselage than the Tu-154.
Wing-mounted engines with a distinctive aerodynamic profile.
Larger cargo area, aimed at regional aviation.
Sturdy, compact design noticeable in its construction.
Yak-42: Tri-engine configuration similar to the Tu-154 design.
Slender fuselage with a rounded nose.
High-mounted wing structure improving aerodynamics.
Larger cabin windows compared to older aircraft designs.
Tail-mounted engines that differentiate it from other tri-jets.
